byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: United States and its European allies face difficult challenge of taking fight to Islamic State group in urban areas, like Raqqa, Syria, where militants surround themselves with civilian population; residents of Raqqa say extremist group does this intentionally, even as group, in its recruitment efforts, decries number of civilian casualties caused by US airstrikes.
lead_paragraph: As President Obama pledged to intensify the anti-Islamic State campaign, he acknowledged the challenges in targeting militants who, in Raqqa, Syria, and elsewhere, inhabit the same spaces as civilians.

headline.main: In ISIS Strategy, U.S. Weighs Risk to Civilians
headline.print_headline: In ISIS Strategy, U.S. Weighs Risk to Population

snippet: As President Obama pledged to intensify the anti-Islamic State campaign, he acknowledged the challenges in targeting militants who, in Raqqa, Syria, and elsewhere, inhabit the same spaces as civilians.
